title: Lewiston, Finally, Gathers to Grieve
description: Residents in and around the city, no longer under lockdowns, spent the weekend coming together to mourn, share meals and prepare to bury their dead.

title: Studios Said to See Progress in Talks With Striking Actors
description: The entertainment companies are growing optimistic that the work stoppage may end soon, though some issues remain unresolved, people briefed on the matter said.

title: How Years of Israeli Failures on Hamas Led to a Devastating Attack
description: Israeli officials completely underestimated the magnitude of the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas, shattering the country’s once invincible sense of security.

title: Israel, It’s Time to Consider a Cease-fire
description: It’s time for Israel to consider a cease-fire.

title: Maine Gunman Disclosed He Had Mental Health Issues, Gun Shop Owner Says
description: The man sought to purchase a gun silencer in August but was denied after self-reporting mental health issues on a federal form, the gun store owner said.

title: Robert Brustein, Passionate Force in Nonprofit Theater, Dies at 96
description: A critic and dramatist himself, he started repertory companies at Yale and Harvard and fiercely defended the art form, even if it meant feuding with playwrights.

title: Matthew Perry Is Mourned by Friends and Colleagues
description: Fans and celebrities paid tribute to Perry, who died at age 54 on Saturday.

title: Matthew Perry Made It Look Easy
description: Even as he struggled with drug and alcohol addiction, the “Friends” star Matthew Perry, who died at the age of 54, made it all look easy.

title: ‘Five Nights at Freddy’s’ Is Surprise Box Office Hit
description: “Five Nights at Freddy’s,” which sold an estimated $78 million in tickets at North American theaters, reinforced moviegoers’ desire for something other than a sequel.

title: A Chill in the Air and Chili in Your Pot
description: Turkey chili, chili con carne, black bean chili with mushrooms, white bean chili with lamb — our chili collection is comprehensive comfort.

title: As Fighting Rages, Ukraine Takes Its Battle to the Diplomatic Arena
description: A forum in Malta was intended to encourage countries that have taken a neutral stance on the invasion of Ukraine not to side with Russia.

title: Joe Biden Knows What He’s Doing
description: The combination of tragedy, confusion and cost is what makes leadership so difficult.

title: Matthew Perry’s Most Memorable TV Shows and Movies to Stream Now
description: Perry will always be remembered as Chandler Bing. But he had a long and varied career that included films and many other series.

title: Israeli Troops in Gaza
description: The war’s “next stage” has started.

title: Jenna Ellis Could Become a Star Witness Against Trump
description: She has given prosecutors a powerful tool.

title: A Gaza Pediatrician’s Desperate Plea for Fuel for Hospitals
description: There is still hope we can avoid the worst outcomes.

title: The Devil’s Bargain Mike Pence Could Not Escape
description: The former vice president tied himself to Donald Trump in the 2016 campaign and it may have cost him a political future.

title: Summer Lee and Other Democrats Face Potential Primary Challenges for Israel-Palestine Views
description: Representative Summer Lee of Pennsylvania, who joined calls for a cease-fire, has become one of several progressive lawmakers facing new pressure from primary challengers.

title: Halloween Shoppers Not Spooked as Economic Slowdown Remains Elusive
description: From apple picking to skeleton cows, early seasonal spending seems solid. It’s the latest sign that Federal Reserve policy to combat inflation hasn’t tanked growth.

title: Halloween Headaches in Salem, Mass.: Traffic. Crowds. Tiny Liquor Bottles?
description: Miniature bottles of alcohol known as “nips” litter gardens, parks and playgrounds, prompting the Witch City to propose a ban.

title: Reaction to Hamas Attack Leaves Some Jews in Hollywood Feeling Unmoored
description: The response to the Oct. 7 assault, and to Israel’s retaliation, has revealed a schism in the entertainment world that many did not realize was there.

title: Tug-of-War Over N.B.A. Rights Provides Glimpse of Media’s Future
description: The league’s longtime television partners, including ESPN and Turner, are undergoing major changes, which could alter how games are watched.

title: Obama’s Presidential Center Is Rising, Finally, in Chicago
description: The city beat out others to host Barack Obama’s presidential center. But as construction continues on the South Side, some residents fear being priced out.

title: From Smugglers and TikTok, Migrants Get a Message: Go to New York
description: Many migrants entering the U.S. southern border have been steered to New York City by relatives, politicians and smugglers, in part because of the city’s right-to-shelter policy.

title: Matthew Perry, ‘Friends’ Star, Dies at 54
description: Mr. Perry, who died on Saturday, was best known for his role in “Friends,” the NBC sitcom that followed a group of young professionals living in Manhattan.

title: Maine Gunman Made Threats Against His Army Base Last Month, Sheriff Says
description: The sheriff said that the threats prompted an alert to all law enforcement agencies in the state, weeks before the gunman, an Army reservist, fatally shot 18 people this week.
